Goldbricks,"2017-06-08T03:43:28.143Z","Review of 30611 R2-D2 Polybag","

Hi today I'
column2: m reviewing the very nice and exclusive version of the famous Astromech Droid, R2-D2 in polybag 30611.&nbsp

column1: Overview
Name:
Theme:
Year:
<strong>Pieces:&nbsp
Minifigures:
Price:
column2: Promotional Item, free one (1) pack with purchase of any LEGO&reg

column1: &nbsp

This is the front and back for the polybag. You can see R2 is standing on the sand scene, maybe going different direction from C3PO after a little fight. At the back of the pack, you can peek through the translucent part and see the head of R2 hiding inside.
Faster open the polybag and bring out my beloved R2-D2!
*C3PO and Jawa are not included in this set. They will be in pictures below for illustration purpose.
The plastic bag material is quite fragile, so you need to be very gentle or else the whole thing will be thorn apart and you'
column2: ll need to pick up the pieces scattered on the floor. The first thing I took out was the big head of R2.

column1: Inside you'
column2: ll get a small bag of smaller parts, an instruction booklet, and other parts listed in the picture below.

column1: *C3PO and Jawa and small R2D2 are not included in this set. They will be in pictures below for illustration purpose.
These are the parts included in the set. Quite a few technic pins and parts for articulation and curved top bricks for the body of R2-D2.
Wake up R2, the Jawas are going to sell us or melt us! I prefer selling, at least we got a new master.
Lets start building. The first step will have something like a post box as the main frame of the body.
Then you will build the outer curve of the body fixed to the post box.
Oh now you get a photocopy machine as the body. The jumpers are for the vents to be attached later on. C3PO is holding the bottom part of R2 that will hold its center leg.
Now you&#39
column3: s right and left legs and attached to the body via the technic pin. See how C3PO is so impatient that he asked me to faster put R2D2 together.

column1: These two are the printed parts in this set and I really love the dome shaped head! So nicely printed and it has a slight metallic feel of the silver colour.
Here is the comparison between the brick built R2 head and the minifigure R2 head. The difference is that there is a stud on top of the smaller R2 and all other printings are quite the same.
Tadaaa! Now we are completed the build of R2D2! The Jawas are taking them in their sandcrawler to seek for new buyers.
These are the extra parts for this set. Just in case you lose one of these.

As you can see in the picture, the brick built R2 will lean forward at a gradient as the center leg is longer than both right and left. Unlike the minifigures, this R2 cannot stand straight unless you remove the center part of the leg and the clip. However, I liked the fact that its head can be rotated 360 degrees, just like in the movies!
*Light blue R2D2(10225) and dark blue R2D2(75136) are not included in this set. They will be in pictures below for illustration purpose.
Now I'
column2: ve removed the center leg and you can pose it like others with any degree of inclination you want. I like it so much that he is so flexible!

column1: Oh no! The Jawas are catching us! Run faster R2!
Haha, now who'
Conclusion

This polybag is very nice to be collected if you are a Star Wars fan. The built is very accurate instead of bulky feel. It has a very sleek design and very detailed in this size. Now I hope there is a brick built C3PO to be his partner. Thanks for reading!

,TRUE,5,3,5,3,5 Kabba","2018-04-26T14:20:32.757Z","(KAB) Unique twist on a classic","

Parts
This poly-bag
column2: offers a surprising amount of unique or rare parts, the set contains no stickers, so all detailed pieces are printed. Some of the most notable are R2 D2&#39
column3: s dome, only seen in 10215, which&nbsp
column4: is a hard to get UCS set.

column1: Building
The building of this set was fairly quick, but did feel rather repetitious when building the legs considering the scale of the build, but none the less is still only a poly-bag.
Playability
The set is not that playable due too its unique scale compared to other lego figures, and it also lacks wheels, making it difficult to '
column3: around. It is also somewhat fragile if held for too long.

column1: Value for Money

The value of this set for how much it costs feels tremendous compared to other poly-bags that have been released, considering the amount of unique parts it contains, and for how the build looks on the outside, I would certainly recommend it.
Overall
The build itself is Amazing, lego
column2: has released many R2 D2 variants (scale wise), but this one not only stands out in size, but also detail. This is by far one of lego&#39
column3: s better poly-bags for starwars, and I hope they do plan on making other droids on this scale (Gonk Droid, C3 P0, Mouse droid, etc)
